meanings.definition: An allusive or oblique remark or hint, typically a suggestive or disparaging one.
meanings.sent1: She made innuendoes about his work ethic, hinting that he was lazy.
meanings.sent2: The gossip was full of innuendoes about her personal life.
meanings.sent3: The innuendoes in the conversation made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: His innuendoes were like hidden arrows, striking at people's weaknesses.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's innuendoes were so subtle, yet everyone understood their meaning.

meanings.definition: A veiled or equivocal reflection on character or reputation.
meanings.sent1: The article was filled with innuendoes about the politician's honesty.
meanings.sent2: Her raised eyebrow was an innuendo about his trustworthiness.
meanings.sent3: The innuendoes in the play added a layer of mystery to the characters.
meanings.sent4: The whispers in the room were like innuendoes floating in the air.
meanings.sent5: His smile was an innuendo of mischief, hinting at his playful nature.
